question_text: When a device fails to ping 8.8.8.8 but can ping the default gateway, what does this suggest?
answer_options: There is no internet connectivity beyond the local network
The device has an invalid IP address
correct_answer: There is no internet connectivity beyond the local network
explanation: Pinging the gateway confirms local access. Failure to reach an external IP like 8.8.8.8 indicates a WAN or ISP issue.
